title: Ticket #3740: Fix soap_job_tests on master
description:
soap_job_tests is enabled and working on V7_8-branch. It's been disabled on master because it's not working. It should be fixed.

This is hindering #3698: Proper gsoap crashes. The test successfully detected a problem with a proposed patch for #3698, but only after the commit was cherry picked from master to V7_8-branch. A similar problem on master only would have been more easily overlooked.
remarks:
2013-Aug-02 18:28:16 by bbockelm:
Looks like the issue isn't the linking changes, but the addition of "-DWITH_IPV6" (removing only that change makes the test pass again).

I think some parts of HTCondor which use gsoap get this flag while others don't. The hunt is on as to which...

2013-Aug-03 11:50:54 by bbockelm:
Looks like condor got built with IPv6 support - but the gsoap external did not.

This is now fixed - soap_job_tests is passing on master.

TJ, can I backport this to 8.0? Proper builds for RHEL6 and Debian fail without this.

2013-Aug-05 17:17:24 by adesmet:
Appears to fix the test on master. However, it changes an existing external; we really should rev the external to 2.7.10-p6 to ensure we don't use older builds. (This exact problem cause me some confusion.)

Also, this particular patch (or lack of a patch) is breaking proper builds on V7_8-branch? Are you referring to #3698? Or the combination of both?

2013-Aug-06 13:54:04 by adesmet:
Also, I believe this means SOAP was busted in 8.1.0. As such, this requires documentation as a bug fix in the version history.

2013-Aug-12 16:10:11 by adesmet:
The test is probably still disabled and needs reenabling: if doing so isn't obvious, ask bt to do it.
check_ins:
2013-Aug-03 11:46   Check-in [37089]: Make sure gsoap external is built with ipv6 support. #3740 (By Brian Bockelman )
2013-Aug-03 09:18   Check-in [37086]: Make sure gsoap external is built with ipv6 support. #3740 (By Brian Bockelman )
creator: adesmet
